creator.name: Financiële administratie van St. Eustatius
creator.his_func: From the late 17th to early 19th century, several civil servants, like the auction master, the collector of import and export duties, and the weigh-house master, were entrusted with financial matters. When Dutch rule was reestablished on St Eustatius and Saba in 1816 after the second British interregnum, the financial administration came under the supervision of a bookkeeper general. Other civil servants entrusted with the collection and control of monies, like the secretary, the collector-general, the auction master, had to submit accounts to the bookkeeper general. In 1828 the second alderman of the municipal administration was entrusted with the financial matters of the colony, under the supervision of the Governor.
